rules.team_multidisciplinary: The HACCP team includes multidisciplinary members with collective knowledge of the product, process, and food safety hazards. Team composition includes production, quality, maintenance, and sanitation representation.
rules.team_leader_authority: The HACCP team leader has the authority to make food safety decisions, stop production when critical limits are exceeded, and allocate resources for HACCP system maintenance and improvement.
rules.training_verification: HACCP team members complete formal HACCP training covering the 7 HACCP principles and 12 preliminary steps. Training certificates or documentation are maintained in personnel files.
rules.flow_diagram_accuracy: The process flow diagram is verified annually by physically walking the process from receiving through shipping. Verification confirms all steps, inputs, and potential hazards are accurately represented.
rules.hazard_analysis_comprehensive: The hazard analysis considers all potential biological (pathogens, allergens), chemical (cleaning agents, pesticides, heavy metals), and physical (glass, metal, plastic) hazards at each process step.
rules.scientific_justification_required: Hazard determinations and control measures are supported by scientific literature, regulatory guidance, pathogen studies, or expert consultation. References are documented in the HACCP plan.
rules.ccp_decision_tree_applied: CCPs are identified using the Codex decision tree or equivalent systematic method. Decision tree application is documented for each significant hazard showing the logic for CCP determination.
rules.critical_limits_validated: Critical limits are validated through scientific studies, challenge studies, regulatory guidance, or expert opinion demonstrating the limits effectively control the identified hazard.
rules.monitoring_continuous_preferred: Monitoring of CCPs is continuous or at a frequency that ensures the CCP remains in control. Continuous monitoring is used wherever technologically and economically feasible.
rules.monitoring_records_realtime: CCP monitoring records are completed in real-time by the person performing the monitoring. Records are not completed retrospectively from memory or after the fact.
rules.corrective_action_immediate: When critical limits are exceeded, corrective action is taken immediately to bring the process back into control. Production does not continue until the CCP is under control.
rules.product_disposition_documented: Product produced when a CCP is out of control is segregated and evaluated for disposition (release, rework, or destroy). Disposition decisions are documented with justification.
rules.verification_independent: HACCP verification activities are conducted by personnel independent of those performing monitoring. Verification includes record review, calibration checks, and observation of monitoring activities.
rules.annual_reassessment: The HACCP plan is reassessed annually or whenever significant changes occur (new product, new hazard, process change, equipment change, regulatory change). Reassessment is documented.
rules.validation_before_implementation: The HACCP plan is validated before implementation to confirm that the plan, when properly implemented, will effectively control the identified hazards.
rules.revalidation_frequency: HACCP plan revalidation is conducted at least every 3 years or when information emerges suggesting the plan may no longer be adequate (recalls, audit findings, new science).
rules.records_complete_accurate: HACCP records (monitoring, corrective actions, verification, validation) are complete, accurate, signed, dated, and maintained for the retention period (minimum 2 years or shelf life plus 6 months).
